args.natural_language_statement:
Final Lean4 file content: import Mathlib and declare theorem that the set of diagonal invertible matrices is a subgroup of the group of invertible matrices. Use Subgroup.{...} on (Matrix n n R)ˣ or on Units (Matrix n n R) ? Write statement: theorem diagonal_subgroup [DecidableEq n] [Fintype n] [CommRing R] :
  (Set.range (fun d : n -> R => Matrix.diagonal d) ∩ (units (Matrix n n R))).to_subgroup? Hmm. Instead: define D : Set (Matrix n n R) := {A | ∀ i j, i ≠ j → A i j =0} and prove Subgroup (units.map?) But easier: prove that the set of diagonal matrices inside (Matrix n n R) forms a subgroup of multiplicative monoid of units: Subgroup ((Matrix n n R)ˣ). Actually units (Matrix n n R) is the type of invertible matrices; we can consider the subgroup: {u : (Matrix n n R)ˣ | ∀ i j, i ≠ j → (u.val) i j = 0}. Write theorem diagonal_subgroup_units : Subgroup (Units (Matrix n n R)) ??? Need exact names.

Write final Lean4 code using Subgroup.mk with carrier and proofs and end with := by sorry.

result:
{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open Matrix
open LinearMap

/-- Final Lean4 file content: import Mathlib and declare theorem that the set of diagonal invertible matrices is a subgroup of the group of invertible matrices. Use Subgroup.{...} on (Matrix n n R)ˣ or on Units (Matrix n n R) ? Write statement: theorem diagonal_subgroup [DecidableEq n] [Fintype n] [CommRing R] :
  (Set.range (fun d : n -> R => Matrix.diagonal d) ∩ (units (Matrix n n R))).to_subgroup? Hmm. Instead:

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Matrix

variable {n : Type _} [DecidableEq n] [Fintype n]
variable {R : Type _} [CommRing R]

/-- A matrix is diagonal if all off-diagonal entries are zero. -/
def is_diagonal (A : Matrix n n R) : Prop := ∀ i j, i ≠ j → A i j = 0

/-- The set of invertible diagonal matrices in GL(n, R) forms a subgroup of the unit group of matrices. -/
theorem diag_units_subgroup :
  ∃ H : Subgroup (Units (Matrix n n R)),
    ∀ u : Units (Matrix n n R), u ∈ H ↔ is_diagonal (u : Matrix n n R) := by sorry
